result.execSummary:
The defendant Najee K Hammond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.
Concurrent with: any other sentence and 15CT1139-Waukesha County

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Najee K Hammond

Def in person & by Atty John E. German.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2,  Court dismissed Count 1 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and enters judgment.
Plea hearing on June 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty John E. German.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.   (Waukesha Co. 15CT1139)  Counsel believes case will resolve as defendant had a medical issue and request to reset until after Waukesha Co. case resolves.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Reset Hearing from 3-16-16 to March 23, 2016 at 11:00 am. for projected resolution after plea in Waukesha Co. case 15CT1139 and for State to prepare otp, per Atty. German.

Def in person & by Atty John E. German.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court continues $1,000.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Atty John E. German appearing for Def.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel advises defendant in Kenosha Co. jail.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
